TextView.android:text: Section 7b (Interview only the parents/guardian)
Screening for Autism spectrum disorder (IASQ)
Child Age
INTERVIEW ONLY THE PARENTS/GUARDIAN
Have poor eye contact?
• Does the child look at you when you call him/her?
• While asking something does he/she look at you?
• Does the child get fussy when forced to look at people?
Lack social smile?
• Does the child smile in response to familiar people (Grandparents, relatives/friends)?
• Does the child smile when someone greets him/her?
• Does he/she smile when father/mother returns home in the evening?
• Does he/she greet others by smiling?
Remain aloof?
• Does the child prefer to be alone rather in a group?
• Does the child like playing with a group of children?
• Does the child want parent's presence while playing or doing any activity?
• Does the child feel comfortable being in a group?
• If he/she is engaged in group activity how does he/she react? Does he/she get irritated or fussy?
• Does he/she ignore the presence of family members?
Not reach out to others?
• Does he/she like being with family members? (Parents, siblings, grandparents)
• Does he/she like playing with his/her siblings/friends?
• Does he/she like going out with family members?
• Does he/she run and hug parents/grandparents/close relatives when they return after a break?
•Is he/she attached to only one family member and ignores others' presence?
Engage in solitary and repetitive play activities?
• Does the child prefer playing the same game again and again for long duration?\n (Like playing with crayons/cars/beads/strings)
• If the child's play is interrupted how does he/she react

• If undisturbed how long does he/she continue the same activity? Does he/she have any fixated interests? (Like playing by keeping the cars in a line or stacking things). When interrupted how does he/she react?
Not maintain peer relationships?
• Does the child have friends?
• Does he/she know the names of his/her friends?
•Does he/she prefer playing with any particular child?
• Does he/she express the wish to play with his/her friends?
• Does he/she like attending his/her friend's birthday parties?
• Does he/she share his/her experiences with his/her friends?
• Does he/she feel close to any particular child?
Is unable to initiate or sustain conversation with others?
• Does the child interact on his/her own with others?
• Does the child ask questions?
• Can the child sustain conversation with others (family members, teachers, and friends)?
• If yes, check the frequency and duration.
• Does he/she respond mostly by nodding his/her head or by saying yes or no?
Engage in stereotyped/repetitive motor mannerisms?
• Does he/she engage in repetitive behaviours like hand flapping, head nodding, finger wiggling and body rocking?
• Ask if the child uses any object while engaging in repetitive activities (spinning objects).
Show attachment to inanimate objects?
• Does the child play with strings, threads/ wires?
• Does the child want to keep any object/toy with him/herself throughout the day?
• If parent tries to take it away how does he/she react?
Respond to objects/people unusually by smelling,touching or tasting?
• Does the child put everything in his/her mouth? (even inedible objects-toys, pens, pencils, crayons)
• Does the child like to smell things? (Dresses, hair, people)
• Does the child touch/hug other people?
• Does he/she express dislike when someone tries to touch him/her?
• Does the child like to eat food of a particular taste?
